intro: Amomum stipulatum, commonly known as the broadleaf cardamom, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its tall, rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces fragrant, three-lobed leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its aromatic seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. The botanical features of Amomum stipulatum make it valuable for both ornamental and practical purposes.
